actor1: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
assoc_actor_1: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Nyatura Militia (CMC/FDP)
source: Kivu Morning Post; Mediacongo.net; Radio Okapi
notes: On 16 May 2025, for the third consecutive day, Wazalendo from CMC-FDP clashed against M23 and recovered control of the area in Bambu/Bambo (Bwito, Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). M23 were pushed back towards Kabizo/Butare. Between 15 and 16 May, 6 people were killed. Fatalities split into 2 events, coded as 3.

actor1: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
notes: On 15 May 2025, Wazalendo clashed against M23 in Showa (Osso, Masisi, Nord-Kivu). Casualties unknown.

actor1: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
notes: On 15 May 2025, Wazalendo clashed against M23 in Ngwaki and Lwansihe, both located in Buabo groupement (Osso, Masisi, Nord-Kivu). Casualties unknown.

assoc_actor_1: CRP: Convention for the People's Revolution
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 15 May 2025, Zaire, with the support of CRP, clashed against FARDC in Tsiku (Bahema-Nord, Djugu, and Ituri) and nearby Katoto (coded separately). Zaire was seeking to stop FARDC from patrolling the area. One FARDC injured (though it's unclear if he was injured in Tsiku or Katoto). MONUSCO deployed to the battle zone to protect civilians.

assoc_actor_1: CRP: Convention for the People's Revolution
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 15 May 2025, Zaire, with the support of CRP, clashed, against FARDC in Katoto (Bahema-Nord, Djugu, and Ituri) and nearby Tsiku (coded separately). Zaire was seeking to stop FARDC from patrolling the area. One FARDC was injured (though it's unclear if he was injured in Katoto or Tsiku). MONUSCO deployed to the battle zone to protect the civilians.

actor2: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Nyatura Militia (CMC/FDP)
source: Kivu Morning Post; Mediacongo.net; MSF; Radio Okapi
notes: On 15 May 2025, for the second of three days, M23 clashed against Wazalendo from CMC-FDP in and around Bambu/Bambo (Bwito, Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The MSF-supported hospital took in over 20 injured people, including 6 with severe injuries. Between 15 and 16 May, 6 people were killed. Fatalities split into 2 events, coded as 3.

assoc_actor_1: CRP: Convention for the People's Revolution
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 15 May 2025, the Zaire-CRP coalition attacked FARDC positions in Lopa town (Bahema-Nord, Djugu, Ituri). Casualties unknown.

actor1: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: ADCP: Action for the Dignity of Congo and its People; UPC: Union of Congolese Patriots; MLP: Lumumbist Progressist Movement
notes: Other: On 15 May 2025, the Congolese government suspended the activities of ADCP, MLP, and UPC political parties. The parties are led respectively by Corneille Nangaa, Franck Diongo, and Thomas Lubanga. ADCP and MLP are accused of supporting M23. Event coded to country's capital, Kinshasa (Kinshasa).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: Movement of forces: On 15 May 2025, FARDC deployed to Kyavinyonge (Bashu, Beni, Nord-Kivu), due to 'a panic provoked by the expansion of M23'.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Twirwaneho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 15 May 2025, FARDC drone bombed Twirwaneho bases in Mikenge (Itombwe, Mwenga, Sud-Kivu). Casualties unknown.

actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: Interception: On 15 May 2025, M23 shot a FARDC drone in Walungu (Ngweshe, Walungu, Sud-Kivu). No further information.

assoc_actor_1: Kalia Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Ambu Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 14 May 2025, a riot over boundary limits took place between residents of Kalia and Ambu villages, located in Panduru groupement, Lu chiefdom, Aru territory, coded to territorial capital Aru (Aru, Ituri). Several people were severely injured, 9 houses set on fire, and 2 kiosks were destroyed and looted. No further details.

On 14 May 2025, teaching inspectors started a strike and held a protest outside the main provincial inspectorate in Kisangani (Kisangani, Tshopo) to denounce the non-payment of their bonuses since 2018.

actor2: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
notes: On 14 May 2025, M23 clashed against Wazalendo in Tchofi (Buhavu, Kalehe, Sud-Kivu). Casualties unknown.

actor2: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
notes: On 14 May 2025, M23 clashed against Wazalendo in Kasheke (Kabare, Kabare, Sud-Kivu). Casualties unknown.

actor2: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
notes: On 14 May 2025, M23 clashed against Wazalendo in Kabamba (Kabare, Kalehe, Sud-Kivu). Casualties unknown.

actor2: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
notes: On 14 May 2025, M23 clashed against Wazalendo in Mabingu (Buhavu, Kalehe, Sud-Kivu). Casualties unknown.

On 14 May 2025, Zaire attacked civilians in Tsenga village, located in Jiba health zone, coded to Jiba (Walendu-Pitsi, Djugu, Ituri). Three people, including two children, were killed. Sources mention the attack could also have been a clash between Zaire and CODECO.

actor1: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 14 May 2025, overnight, Wazalendo from Mayi Mayi Simba clashed against FARDC in Lubutu (Lubutu, Maniema), over a 'misunderstanding'. Casualties unknown. No further details.

actor2: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
notes: On 14 May 2025, M23 launched an offensive on Wazalendo positions at an unspecified location 12 kilometers south of Masisi (Osso, Masisi, Nord-Kivu). Casualties unknown.

actor1: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
assoc_actor_2: Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 14 May 2025, CODECO ambushed IDPs who were looking for food in Lenge village, coded to nearby Bule (Bahema-Badjere, Djugu, Ituri). The IDPs were coming from their site in Tsukpa. CODECO killed an elderly man. 3 other people were disappeared and 40 goats were looted.

actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: Around 14 May 2025 (week of), M23 launched assaults on FDLR positions in the Mozambique area of Virunga National Park (Bashu, Beni, Nord-Kivu). No further details. Casualties unknown.

actor2: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
notes: Around 14 May 2025 (week of), M23 launched assaults on Wazalendo positions in Tongo groupement, coded to Tongo (Bwito, Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). No further details. Casualties unknown.

actor2: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Nyatura Militia (CMC/FDP)
source: Kivu Morning Post; Mediacongo.net; Radio Okapi
notes: On 14 May 2025, for the first of three days, M23 clashed against Wazalendo from CMC-FDP and overtook Bambu/Bambo (Bwito, Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). Casualties unknown.

actor2: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
notes: On 14 May 2025, M23 clashed against Wazalendo and overtook Kishishe/Kishishi (Bwito, Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). Casualties unknown.

actor2: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
notes: On 13 May 2025, M23 clashed against Wazalendo in Katasomwa (Buhavu, Kalehe, Sud-Kivu). Wazalendo pushed M23 back towards Kasheke and Tchofi. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Naval Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Naval Forces
notes: On 13 May 2025, the Congolese navy clashed against the Ugandan navy on Lake Albert, off the coast of Irumu territory, near Rukwanzi Island (Irumu, Ituri). Ugandan military sources say the Ugandan navy mistook FARDC for FRPI militants. Two FARDC were killed and several were injured.

On 13 May 2025, M23 shot dead two civilians in Kibati (Wanianga, Walikale, Nord-Kivu). The killing occurred as M23 was arresting a group of 4 people, two of whom tried to escape, which is when they were shot dead. The other two are still missing.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Looting: On 13 May 2025, overnight, an unidentified armed group looted goods, money and farm animals in Kinyana, a neighborhood of Nyamilima (Bwisha, Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu).

On 13 May 2025, for the fourth consecutive day, M23 continued its mass arrest operation in various unspecified neighborhoods in Goma (Goma, Nord-Kivu) and Sake (coded separately). M23 said the goal of the operation was to tackle insecurity. It is unknown how many people were arrested on 13 May.

On 13 May 2025, for the fourth consecutive day, M23 continued its mass arrest operation in Sake (Bahunde, Masisi, Nord-Kivu) as well as Goma (coded separately). M23 said the goal of the operation was to tackle insecurity. It is unknown how many people were arrested on 13 May.

Security measures: Around 13 May 2025 (as reported), M23 suspended the activities of some civil society organizations in Kamanyola (Ngweshe, Walungu, Sud-Kivu), saying they 'destabilized social cohesion'.

On 13 May 2025, M23 arrested over a hundred residents in Ngangi II (Bukumu, Nyiragongo, Nord-Kivu) and Ngangi III (coded separately). M23 searched houses and arrested people based off suspicions of affiliation with FARDC or Wazalendo, because they did not have IDs, or because of their hairstyle. All arrested were brought to Don Bosco stadium, where those able to prove their 'innocence' were released while others were brought to an unknown destination.

On 13 May 2025, M23 arrested over a hundred residents in Ngangi III (Bukumu, Nyiragongo, Nord-Kivu) and Ngangi II (coded separately). M23 searched houses and arrested people based off suspicions of affiliation with FARDC or Wazalendo, because they did not have IDs, or because of their hairstyle. All arrested were brought to Don Bosco stadium, where those able to prove their 'innocence' were released while others were brought to an unknown destination.

assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Labor Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 12 May 2025, artisanal miners beat up employees and vandalized goods and infrastructure at Shambara mine, exploited by COMAKAT cooperative, in Kawama village (Kipushi, Haut-Katanga). They damaged the dispensary, beat up medical staff and other agents, smashed the windscreens of trucks transporting mining products, and ransacked the offices of the COMAKAT mining cooperative. The mob was led by miners who were initiating a petition to claim their rights. Security services arrested 30 of the rioters.

assoc_actor_2: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
notes: On 12 May 2025, a suspected mob, burned alive two thieves in Miti, also known as Miti- Kabare (Kabare, Sud-Kivu). One of them was part of Wazalendo. They were caught stealing poultry.

On 12 May 2025, the clerks of the Ituri Court of Appeal held placards in front of the courtroom of the public prosecutor's office in Bunia (Bunia, Ituri) to protest their working conditions: bonuses, salaries, promotions, and asset transfers. The group also launched an indefinite strike.

assoc_actor_2: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 12 May 2025, overnight, ADF attacked civilians in Kyamata (Baniari-Tchabi, Irumu, Ituri). They killed the village chief, set two houses on fire and looted goods.

On 12 May 2025, unidentified individuals (likely M23, due to the 'bouclage' operation carried during this period) burned alive four members of the same family in Kabale Katambi, in Rusayo groupement, coded to Rusayo (Nyiragongo, Nord-Kivu) for unknown reasons.

assoc_actor_1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Looting: On 12 May 2025, suspected ADF 'in coalition with a local armed group active in the region' (unspecified) looted more than 400 cows in Boloku, a locality located a dozen kilometers from Komanda (Basili, Irumu, Ituri).
On 12 May 2025, overnight, rioters burned alive 5 people they accused of being bandits at Camp Mbele mining site, located a dozen kilometers from Moku (Mari-Minza, Watsa, Haut-Uele).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Labor Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Looting: Around 12 May 2025, an unidentified armed group stole construction materials belonging to the Congolese Construction Company (SOCOC) on National Road No. 2 (RN2), coded to Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu). The materials were intended for the construction of a culvert, which is part of the RN2 rehabilitation works along the Bukavu-Mwenga axis.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 11 May 2025, a FARDC soldier shot and killed three people during a service at a Christian church in Moanda (also spelled as Muanda) (Moanda, Kongo-Central), including a four-month-old infant. The reasons for the attack are unclear. The soldier was detained by the community and handed over to military justice for judgment.

assoc_actor_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
notes: On 11 May 2025, M23 clashed against two local armed groups, PARECO/FF and Kifuwa-fuwa, in Kibabi (Masisi, Nord-Kivu) and Ufamandu (coded separately), both part of Bahunde chiefdom. A massive displacement was observed from both villages from the morning, with some of the people returning in the evening as the clashes ceased. Casualties unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
notes: On 11 May 2025, M23 clashed with two local armed groups, PARECO/FF and Kifuwa-fuwa, in Ufamandu (Masisi, Nord-Kivu) and Kibabi (coded separately), both part of the Bahunde chiefdom. Massive displacement was observed from both villages in the morning, with some people returning in the evening as the clashes subsided. Casualties unknown.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_1: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: Other: Around 10 May 2025, ICRC and MONUSCO continued the evacuation of FARDC soldiers and police officers from Goma to Kinshasa, coded to Goma (Goma, Nord-Kivu). As of 10 May, more than 800 members of FARDC and Police have been assisted in this process.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Around 10 May 2025 (weekend of), an unidentified armed group shot and injured two people in Goma - Mabanga Nord (Goma, Nord-Kivu), recorded as two separate events in the same location. In both instances, the perpetrators were using a motorcycle. In one incident, the unidentified armed individuals shot a female pharmacist as she left her pharmacy.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Around 10 May 2025 (weekend of), an unidentified armed group on a motorcycle shot and injured two individuals in Goma - Mabanga Nord (Goma, Nord-Kivu), categorized as two separate incidents in the same location. In both instances, the assailants were on a motorcycle. In one incident, a man was shot and wounded in the head.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 10 May 2025, an unidentified armed group attacked the military position in Kamiro 1, Katsa groupement, near the territorial capital of Aru (Kaliko-Omi, Aru, Ituri), injuring a DGM Migration agent. Five houses were burned. This area is located right on the border with South Sudan, where conflict is currently active.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 10 May 2025, an unidentified armed group shot and killed a young man at his home in Goma - Ndosho (Goma, Nord-Kivu).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Around 10 May 2025, an unidentified armed group shot and seriously injured four people under unclear circumstances in Goma - Katoyi (Goma, Nord-Kivu).

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Pastoralists (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mbororo Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Security measures: On 10 May 2025, FARDC gave Mbororo pastoralists 21 days to register in Nambia (Niangara, Haut-Uele), saying FARDC will 'carry out a large-scale operation to track down recalcitrant Mbororo' if they do not comply.

assoc_actor_2: Migrants (Rwanda); Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Around 10 May 2025 (weekend of), M23 carried out an operation to extract at least 300 people from their homes (4,000 according to a Ministry of Interior report), suspectedly looking for FARDC and Wazalendo members in Rukoko (Nyiragongo, Nord-Kivu), and Kiheru, Murambi, Ngangi 1 and 2, Ndosho, Mugunga, Kyeshero, Katoyi, Majengo, Lac Vert, Sake, Kimoka, Munigi and Mutsa (coded separately). After apprehending the targeted individuals, who are mostly young men, they brought them to Kibumba and inspect their ID cards, tattoos, and physical condition to determine whether they are FARDC-Wazalendo members. Only a few people have been released, while the rest are still missing. At least 181 of those retained are of Rwandan nationality in an irregular migration status.

assoc_actor_2: Migrants (Rwanda); Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Around 10 May 2025 (weekend of), M23 carried out an operation to extract at least 300 people from their homes (4,000 according to a Ministry of Interior report), suspectedly looking for FARDC and Wazalendo members in Ngangi II (Nyiragongo, Nord-Kivu), and Rukoko, Kiheru, Murambi, Ngangi 1, Ndosho, Mugunga, Kyeshero, Katoyi, Majengo, Lac Vert, Sake, Kimoka, Munigi and Mutsa (coded separately). After apprehending the targeted individuals, who are mostly young men, they brought them to Kibumba and inspect their ID cards, tattoos, and physical condition to determine whether they are FARDC-Wazalendo members. Only a few people have been released, while the rest are still missing. At least 181 of those retained are of Rwandan nationality in an irregular migration status.

Security measures: On 10 May 2025, a group (likely M23, which has been occupying this territory since January 2025), set up a curfew in response to the worsening security situation in Goma - Ndosho (Goma, Nord-Kivu).

Only a few people have been released, while the rest are still missing. At least 181 of those retained are of Rwandan nationality in an irregular migration status.

Kaina did not rejoin M23 when the rebellion resumed in 2021 due to tensions with M23's military chief, Sultani Makenga. CNLC's objectives have yet to be announced.

Movement of forces: Around 1 March 2025, a military convoy of UPDF/ Ugandan army arrived through the Anzida / Mahagi Border Post, and established their base in Zale (also spelled as Zali) (Mahagi, Ituri). The base was occupied by UPDF since several months, with the last arrival of troops being on 18 February. Several videos of their entrance, taken by the local population circulated on social media. FARDC confirmed this arrival saying that it was part of a signed agreement between the armies for extending the operations area.
Movement of forces: On 1 March 2025, the Ugandan army/UPDF crossed via the border post of Anzida and established their base at the airfield of Zale in Mahagi (Mahagi, Ituri).

The chief of the Ugandan Army announced in a tweet that they'd take control of Bunia to protect the Hema population against CODECO militia. Four military tanks, two armored vehicles and Ugandan soldiers were seen. FARDC clarified in a speech by its spokesman for Ituri (Bunia, Ituri) that UDPF presence in Ituri is part of the joint operations with FARDC against armed groups and it is not an attack, contrary to rumors.

source: Actualite; Mediacongo.net; Radio Okapi; Reuters; UN OHCHR
notes: On 27 January 2025, an estimated 4,763 prisoners [figure chosen based on UN OHCHR (latest report)] escaped in a jailbreak from Munzenze prison in Goma - Virunga (Karisimbi, Goma, Nord-Kivu), following a fire (likely started as mob violence given the context). A significant part of the prison was burnt, killing at least 10 inmates, mainly women and a newborn. At least 165 women were raped during the prison break by male inmates.

Around 27 January 2025 (as reported), ADF attacked the village of Sinzyambale, in Lubero territory, coded to the territorial capital, Lubero (Baswaga, Lubero, Nord-Kivu). Several houses were set on fire. 7 villagers were killed.

Around 27 January 2025 (as reported), ADF attacked the villages of Mangaba, Kyanzaba, coded to territorial capital, Lubero (Baswaga, Lubero, Nord-Kivu), Mausa, and Lumba (coded separately). On 27 January 2025, residents demonstrated in Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu). They denounced Rwanda's aggression in Goma and Nord-Kivu and asked Congolese Government to reinforce the FARDC and react rapidly, and the International community to sanction Rwanda for his actions.
